text: Awesome, if you share the link in the main thread of this channel, others can upvote it so you can gain some traction quicker

My comment was approved!

For anyone interested in exporting HubSpot Inbox Conversations for analytics or reporting, I shared a <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Export-conversations/idc-p/1017294/highlight/true#M189196|potential solution> in the Ideas forum that saves your Inbox data to CSV file.
Just shared! Thank you for recommending posting there. :thank-you:
YW, as soon as I have access back to my profile (long story) I'll be sure to upvote
Np hope you can recover your profile soon! You have some impressive stats on it. :wow:

*Idea:*
> Please create a Form Submissions API endpoint where we can log that a Form was submitted (non-HubSpot form). 
*Why:*
HubSpot's tracking is an easy target for browser settings / browser plugins to block. There are plenty of reasons why you would not want to embed a HubSpot form on a non CMS Hub site. So having the ability to notify HubSpot that a form was submitted after you create / update a Contact record in the CRM would be valuable.

*How does this make life better?*
Well being able to say "Yes marketing team, you can use "Form Submitted" as a workflow trigger" now because the submission is always going to be known is much better than having to explain the reasons why they can't use it.

What about this one ? <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3_authentication>
I use it for some of my clients, it works exactly as you describe.

All I have to do is create the form in HubSpot with the few fields I want to retrieve. I set it up the way I want (lifecycle stage, notifications, hidden fields...), and I generate a submission of this form via the API, also indicating the URL of the page on which the form was submitted. The form parameters will be applied to this submission, as if the form were embedded on the site. And marketing can use the workflows just like any other form.
Please post your idea on <https://ideas.HubSpot.com> then come back here, post the link to your idea, and ask this channel for upvotes :)
username: How to use the Ideas Channel
